attributes.action: Give small Ltd Company Directors the same support as self-employed for Covid-19
attributes.additional_details:
After the chancellors announcement on Thursday 26th March regarding support for the self-employed during the covid19 pandemic, it became clear that the same support was not going to be offered to small owner managed limited companies. 

Dividend income in these small owner managed companies will not be taken into account when calculating what support a director is eligible for. This is despite dividends being subject to both corporation tax and personal income tax.
attributes.background: Directors of small Limited companies have been overlooked by the chancellor when supporting both employed and self-employed people during the covid-19 pandemic. Allow small owner managed company directors to claim the same as everyone else.

rejection.details:

Provide COVID19 income support for the newly self-employed, without HMRC records: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

Coronavirus Support Package for Directors / Shareholders of small Limited Co's: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310515

Get HMRC to refund the Self-Employed their Jan 2020 1st Tax Payment on Account: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304995

Bring forward COVID-19 Self-employment grants to April 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310898

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
